solution_line_template: Bert was able to earn {bert_phones_sold} x ${bert_price_per_phone} = $<<{bert_phones_sold}*{bert_price_per_phone}={bert_earnings}>>{bert_earnings} for the toy phones.
While Tory was able to earn {tory_guns_sold} x ${tory_price_per_gun} = $<<{tory_guns_sold}*{tory_price_per_gun}={tory_earnings}>>{tory_earnings} for the toy guns.
Therefore, Bert was able to earn ${bert_earnings} – ${tory_earnings} = $<<{bert_earnings}-{tory_earnings}={difference_in_earnings}>>{difference_in_earnings} more than Tory.
